title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORAL APPROACHES

description.narrative: Strategies to address cross cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied, such as DRR and operational support for delivery of programme results., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2020, evidence generation and advocacy for evidence based policy decisions enhanced.

sector.narrative: Institutional strengthening/policy support/advocacy/education on integration of climate change concerns
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address cross cutting issues related to child rights are developed and applied, such as DRR and operational supportfor delivery of programme results.

description.narrative: To improve coordination of the emergency response, UNICEF Swaziland strengthened the WASH, education and health and nutrition clusters to deliver life-saving and resilience-building interventions in Shiselweni and Lubombo. Also supported was the development of a C4D strategy, supporting partners to deliver social and behaviour change communication. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2017
